fields.description: See attachments.
fields.summary: Bitbucket is broken in my Google Chrome

fields.description:
Hi,

We are running Mecurial 1.8.2 and are running the 2.1.1 version of the client.

We have a repo with 177,000 files and 14,476 folders.

I have a number of files that needed to be shelved (around 50 files, around 20 MB) which I shelved. This exercise took around 20 minutes.

I then re-synchronised with our repo which included around 20 changesets with 440 odd file changes. This pull and update occurred fairly quickly, around 20 - 30 seconds.

I then went into the shelve option in the workbench, selected my shelve set and clicked to retrieve it. I have been sitting for 40 minutes waiting for the files to unshelve and it has yet to complete.

When I look at the task manager the tortoise application is certainly busy.

Is this a known issue? Surely it cannot take this long to unshelve files? Is there a setting that we may be missing on our side?

Thanks,\\
Anton
fields.summary: Shelve and unshelve dead slow in TortoiseHg 2.1.1 (Large repo)

fields.description:
would be a nice to have,\\
every time i do repo cleanup,\\
i have to enter passwords
fields.summary: cofirmation form instead of password field for repo deletion

fields.description:
==== Steps to reproduce ====

h1. Open a list of your own repositories https://bitbucket.org/repo/mine
h1. Observe number of followers for different repositories (number near heart icon).
==== Actual result ====\\
Some private repositories have, for example, 3 followers. Though clicking at https://bitbucket.org/<UserName>/<RepoName>/zealots reveals that there is only 1 follower.

==== Expected result ====\\
Display the same number of followers in repo list and in https://bitbucket.org/<UserName>/<RepoName>/zealots

Nice to have - indicate that the only follower is yourself.

===== Notes =====\\
My main concern is private repositories, noticing that a private repository has more than 1 follower caused a mild paranoid fit.
fields.summary: Different number of forks/followers in repo list and in repo forks/zealots page (BB-639)

fields.description:
With the latest UI updates, a README file with the markdown comment preamble is not parsed anymore.

Here's an example repository: https://bitbucket.org/anhero/redboxapp

Here's the preamble used\\
{{{

<!-- -*- markdown -*- -->}}}

as recommended here\\
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Displaying+README+Text+on+your+Bitbucket+Source+Tab

Thanks!
fields.summary: README file with markdown preamble is not parsed anymore (BB-4431)

fields.description:
Hi,

I'm using Thunderbird, and I use message filters to move mails to the right folder when they arrive. But all issue norifications coming from Bitbucket have the same sender, whether they come from the issue tracker for BB  itself, or from some other repo's issue tracker. So I'm not capable anymore to seperate them.

Is there any possibility to add the repo name somewhere in the address or the reply address of issue tracker notifications, so they can be seperated properly ?

Johan
fields.summary: add repo name in issue email notification

fields.description: Please allow selection of other date formats at bitbucket.org.  I am used to dates in YYYY-MM-DD format (e.g. 2011-07-30) but you print in DD Mmm YYYY (e.g. 30 July 2011). I am sure other nationalities would also appreciate it. Thank you!
fields.summary: Allow different date formats at bitbucket.org (BB-51)

fields.description:
Hi,

The issue editor can be made wider and higher using the handle in the lower right corner. Which I think is  a great feature. But I experienced some layout imperfections doing this.

# It would be nice if the width of the preview would also be automatically adjusted to that of the editor.
# It would be nice if the height of the preview would also be automatically adjusted to that of the editor.
# It would be nice if the editor was lowered a bit, when making it\\
wider, so the administration fields stay completely in view.

I attached a screenshot making things clear visually.

The same remark/request is valid for when adding a comment. And when adding a comment the handy blue border around the editor is missing too ;-).

Greets,\\
Johan
fields.summary: self-adjusting layout when making issue editor wider or higher (BB-2093)

fields.description:
Hi,

Is the POST service working? I have entered the URL of my CI server but I don't seem to receive the http request. Is there a way I can test this?

Thanks in advance,

Kevin.
fields.summary: POST Service

fields.description:
This is more of a consistency issue. I don't think anybody seriously would do this, but nevertheless. I cannot commit to a repository named *.

I changed the repo to a word with just latin-1, and it worked fine. I also changed my password to make sure my password was as I typed it.

== ssh fails: ==\\
{{{\\
#!sh\\
ww@mir:~/* $ hg push\\
pushing to ssh://hg@bitbucket.org/winstonw/*\\
remote: conq: invalid command syntax.\\
abort: no suitable response from remote hg!\\
}}}

== HTTPS fails:==\\
{{{\\
#!sh\\
ww@mir:~/* $ hg push\\
pushing to https://winstonw@bitbucket.org/winstonw/*\\
searching for changes\\
http authorization required\\
realm: Bitbucket.org HTTP\\
user: winstonw\\
password:\\
abort: authorization failed\\
}}}
fields.summary: Cannot Commit to Repository * (BB-2132)

fields.description: Can't delete messages in my inbox and outbox.
fields.summary: mail

fields.description:
Well, http://livejournal.com/ is down today and with it my two OpenIDs, so I decided to try to create a password so I can log in using a username/password combination. So I went to the change password form, and entered a blank "Old Password", since I didn't have one, and the new password twice. It didn't work - I got invalid password.

Please fix it.
fields.summary: Cannot create password for OpenID-initiated account.

fields.description:
From the tutorial:  "There are several commands that allow to to set bug properties. They are all fairly straightforward, so we will merely point them out here, and refer you to be help COMMAND for more details."

That's not been my experience.

How does one close a bug?  It sure would have been nice to have an example of this.  If you want your tutorial to say "read the manual," then keep it that way, but I would really prefer examples.

django:notes sgeiger [master] $ be list\\
843/e29:om: need document outlining how to install bugs everywhere\\
django:notes sgeiger [master] $ be show\\
ID : e29b5f66-e7eb-4a2a-bccb-d36b75cf62d6\\
Short name : 843/e29\\
Severity : minor\\
Status : open\\
Assigned :\\
Reporter : Shane Geiger [sgeiger%40django]\\
Creator : Shane Geiger [sgeiger%40django]\\
Created : Sun, 24 Jul 2011 14:35 (Sun, 24 Jul 2011 12:35:14 +0000)\\
need document outlining how to install bugs everywhere

django:notes sgeiger [master] $ be status closed e29b5f66-e7eb-4a2a-bccb-d36b75cf62d6\\
Invalid id:\\
No id matches e29b5f66-e7eb-4a2a-bccb-d36b75cf62d6.\\
[u'843c1abc-6f7d-4c92-bab0-d6f046adc044']\\
django:notes sgeiger [master] $
fields.summary: Documentation doesn't show how to close a bug

fields.description:
After I've imported this URL into a new repository (after pressing the "+" sign):

https://svn.berlios.de/svnroot/repos/quad-pres/lm-solve/site/

The import was successful, but then Firefox kept reloading the page times and again, without stopping. Even pressing the "Stop" button or pressing a link could not stop it. I had  to close the tab.

I'm using Firefox 5.0 on Mandriva Linux Cooker on an x86-64 Acer laptop.
fields.summary: Importing the lm-solve site from svn.berlios.de causes Firefox 5.0 to repeatedly reload the page.

fields.description: It would be great if we could follow/unfollow a repository/issue/user via the API. Currently the following resource is view only.
fields.summary: Follow a Repository (or other entity) via API

fields.description:
I happened upon the link for http://www.libgd.org/, which told me "Site is sadly not available. We are working to restore the wiki and the downloads as soon as possible." I wondered if the site was archived through www.archive.org, and it was -- this might help your team to recreate the page:

http://web.archive.org/web/20100821112440/http://www.libgd.org/Main_Page
fields.summary: This might be of help in recreating your wiki

fields.description:
In order to reproduce this issue, create a repository, create default and develop branches, and then folk the repository.  Once forked, work on a new feature branch in the clone, and then send a pull request from the new branch, specifying develop as the destination branch.

Although you ask asked for a commit message, inspection of the parent repository will reveal that the merge happened on the default branch, regardless of the fact you have specified that develop is the destination branch.

If you are using named branches, this means that it is not possible to use this feature.
fields.summary: Pull request allow specification of destination branch, which is ignored (BB-2125)

fields.description:
===== Info: =====\\
My username is *thejeshgn* is mapped to  *code.thejeshgn.com*

===== Problem: =====\\
I wanted to embed a piece of code. So I went to\\
http://code.thejeshgn.com/snippets/src/429f9630a4a9/GoogleDoodle/AlexanderCalder/ac.js

and copied the embed code\\
{{{\\
#!html

<script src="https://bitbucket.org/snippets/src/429f9630a4a9/GoogleDoodle/AlexanderCalder/ac.js?embed=t"></script>}}}\\
Which is wrong because its missing my user id.

It should have been\\
{{{\\
#!html

<script src="http://code.thejeshgn.com/snippets/src/429f9630a4a9/GoogleDoodle/AlexanderCalder/ac.js?embed=t"></script>		}}}

or

{{{\\
#!html

<script src="http://bitbucket.org/thejeshgn/snippets/src/429f9630a4a9/GoogleDoodle/AlexanderCalder/ac.js?embed=t"></script>		}}}

Now you owe me a coffee.\\
Thej
fields.summary: Code embed code is wrong,

fields.description: The newsfeed is great for driving users to changes from repositories, issues and other users that they care about. It would be great if this information was exposed in the API. Right now you can only get the events for a specific user or repository, not the events for the items a user is following.
fields.summary: Expand Dashboard Newsfeed to API (BB-16)

fields.description:
I am able to log into my Atlassian  account, but cannot log into my Bitbucket using my email address. Am wondering if it is because of the hyphen in the domain name, I have run into problems before where email validators have not been set to accept them.\\
My email is jfields@aask-az.org
fields.summary: Unable to log into my Bitbucket account

fields.description: There is no possibility to discuss a pull request at the moment. I suggest to automatically (but optionally) create an issue related to a pull request so that you can discuss it in there. When a pull request is accepted or rejected the issue can be automatically closed.
fields.summary: Automatically create an issue related to a pull request (BB-2120)

fields.description: I did a search for 'fem', and there was one repository that had a really long description (the code from their project was in the description).  I would suggest displaying only a shortened version of descriptions.
fields.summary: Really long descriptions in search (BB-7236)

fields.description: The "source" tab shows last commit messages next to each file. It would be quite useful if these messages were clickable so you could pass directly to the corresponding commit.
fields.summary: Links to last commits at the "source" tab (BB-2118)

fields.description: I think the screenshot can describe it better.
fields.summary: Issues menu appears below the commit search panel (BB-2121)

fields.description:
When specifying multiple filters of the same type, by default the assumption is that only one of the selected values should be matched, i.e.-\\
Status <is> "open"\\
*or* <is> "new"

I would like to see the ability to change *or* to *and* via a dropdown (or toggle), so that the following filter is possible:\\
Version <is not> "1.0 alpha"\\
*and* <is not> "1.0 beta"
fields.summary: Allow "and" condition for searching issues (BB-2122)

fields.description:
Bitbucket does not support searching the source code of a repository.

It seems that source code search (and really, a repo-wide search that would cover code, wiki, issues, etc) would be extremely useful.\\
Once repo-level searching is implemented, then maybe it could be extended to global Bitbucket search functionality across all available repos as well (similar to what Github allows, but hopefully without Github's lacking ease-of-use, as searching a specific repo at Github is definitely not intuitive).

*EDIT:* Please click to *Vote* for this issue (available to the right), rather than adding a *+1*. Only add a comment to this thread if you have something to say other than *+1* or *"me too"*.  Otherwise you're just spamming the rest of us.

*EDIT 2:* Obviously this request isn't drawing enough attention from Bitbucket, as we have almost 1000 votes right now, 300+ comments, and no resolution or updates from Bitbucket. So, let's turn up the heat!

Post on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, and tag Bitbucket.

Tell them you want this feature. Use hashtag *[#bbynosearch|https://twitter.com/hashtag/bbynosearch%3Fsrc%3Dhash]*

* https://twitter.com/bitbucket
* https://www.facebook.com/Bitbucket
* https://plus.google.com/+Bitbucket

per @turtledovepdx: "two most current work arounds: http://crandellws.bitbucket.org/reposearch/ and http://sourcetreeapp.com/download/ seem to be the best way (other than grepping your local repo.)"
fields.summary: Ability to search source code? (BB-39)

fields.description:
As the issue tracker uses Creole markup in same fashion as Wiki, this may be a wiki bug?

According to Bitbucket markup documentation, nested lists are supported, yet I cannot achieve nested lists within Issue Tracker. I have not tested Wiki for this ability.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+Wiki+Markup+in+Bitbucket

Nested list not working ex:

* Item\\
** Sub item

h1. Numbered item
h2. Numbered sub item
*EDIT:* Ahhh... So the error is in the live preview, as the nested list renders properly after submission. That was giving me hell last night...
fields.summary: Nested list support is missing from issue description preview (BB-2123)

fields.description:
It would be quite nice if we could save issue filtering and sorting.\\
Ideally we would be able to save presets on the project level and at the user level, and additionally designate the default filter to use on both project and user level.
fields.summary: Persistent filter/sort for issue tracker

fields.description:
When creating a new ticket, you can link to an issue, issue query, changeset, or user.

When editing the same ticket, you see each of those icons except the user icon. The hover text on each icon is different than when creating ticket. Clicking each icon produces results different than when creating ticket, and results apparently are incorrect.
fields.summary: Inconsistent handling of issue linking, wysiwyg (BB-2124)

fields.description: https://bitbucket.org/cpriest/bmg_cms/issue/37/laredoseniorhousingcom-shows-two-domains

{{{\\
faheem@orwell:~/snppy-paper_plos/.hg/patches-plos$ hg paths\\
default = ssh://bulldog_hg//srv/hg/faheem/snppy-paper/.hg/patches-plos\\
bbmq = ssh://hg@bb/faheem/snppy-paper-patches-plos\\

pushing to ssh://hg@bb/faheem/snppy-paper-patches-plos\\
searching for changes\\
searching [    <=>    ]\\
abort: repository is unrelated\\
}}}

The snppy-paper-patches-plos is currently empty, so I'm not sure what the message is talking about. BB creates an automated init, but I just stripped that.
fields.summary: bb won't allow pushing to empty patch queue

fields.description: I would like to see the branch to which a commit applies sent to CIA.vc so that they may show up in CIA bot messages.  For reference, it goes in the same spot the project is in the message sent to CIA.vc with the tag <branch>.
fields.summary: Send the branch to which a commit applies to CIA.vc (BB-2089)

fields.description:
Lately every time I perform a website action that makes use of AJAX (such as adding a new entry to my issue tracker's Components), I get a never-ending-spinner. Refresh the page, the change is there.

*Note:* This is not limited to the Admin area of a project, this issue has occurred in various locations as I've used Bitbucket in the past week or so.

I would pull up Javascript Debugger in Chrome to help out, but I have enough bugs of my own to troubleshoot. :-)

Cheers
fields.summary: AJAX errors at Bitbucket?

fields.description: I inadvertantly forked a fork of a repo instead of the original repo. Now I can only submit a pull request to the fork. Why is this? It seems logical that I should be able to submit a pull request to any ancestor repo.
fields.summary: Should be able to submit a pull request to any ancestor repo (BB-2090)

fields.description:
To reproduce:

h1. Go to the Admin panel for a repository.
h1. Click on "Issue tracker settings"
h1. Under "Components", "Versions", or "Milestones", enter the text for the new element and click the 'add' button.
The 'add' button should now be turned into a spinning graphic and you are unable to enter additional elements without refreshing the webpage. The elements that were added are actually recorded though and DO show up when the webpage is manually refreshed.

Additionally, clicking the remove icon (red button with a minus in it) to remove a component/version/milestone turns the red button into a spinner and doesn't update the webpage unless it is manually refreshed.

As well, the spinning busy icon also replaces the "Set default values for new issues" button when it is clicked.

This bug has been reproduced in Chrome, Safari, and Firefox for Mac, and Chrome and Firefox for Windows.
fields.summary: Adding/removing a new Component/Version/Milestone to the issue tracker stalls interface (BB-2075)

fields.description:
Two suggestions for making it easier to page through issues in issue tracker:

h1. Put paging controls at the top of the list also; I shouldn't have to scroll to the bottom to go to the next page
h1. Give user control of the number of issues displayed on a page; it is fixed at 25 and there's no obvious way to get more than that at a time (short of using the api)
fields.summary: Add paging for issue tracker list (BB-2091)

fields.description:
= First attempt\\
== Steps to reproduce

h1. Open an issue in issue tracker
h1. Click on title
h1. Select and change title text
h1. Click in comment box
== Desired behavior\\
Title text input should retain new title and should be submitted with the rest of the changes.

== Observed behavior\\
Arrghh!  It reverted back to the original!

okay, so on to...\\
= Second attempt\\
== Steps to reproduce

h1. Open an issue in issue tracker
h1. Click on title
h1. Select and change title text
h1. Press enter first, *then* click in comment box
== Desired behavior\\
Title text input should retain new title and should be submitted with the rest of the changes.

== Observed behavior\\
Ack!  New title is submitted via AJAX immediately, unleashing unnecessary, mailbox-cluttering, and possibly premature issue notification messages on all issue followers!
fields.summary: Allow issue title and description to be edited as a single action (BB-2092)

fields.description:
== Steps to reproduce\\ Create a bug with successive H2 + body text elements (like this one) == Desired behavior\\ H2 elements should visually delineate the distinct sections. That is, while there may be more vertical space between the h2 element and the text that follows it than between lines of body text, there should certainly be more space *above* the h2 element to set it off from the preceding section than there is below it. == Observed behavior\\ The h2 element has no space above it and quite a lot below it. Visually it appears to be grouped with the previous body text, not the text which follows. == Further diagnosis\\ The problem is really that the

element has {margin-top: 1em} I suggest that

should be {margin-bottom: 1em} instead. Or perhaps you could add hx + p {margin-top: 0} rules for each heading level. Also, margin-top for all heading levels should be at least as much as, and preferably more than, its corresponding margin-bottom.
fields.summary: issue tracker css: heading margins backwards (BB-2093)

fields.description:
I am trying to import an svn repository to bit bucket.

For some reason, my url is not being accepted. It is in the format

svn://[url]/[repository name]

Please let me know if there is something I am missing.
fields.summary: import directly from svn repository

fields.description:
Receiving a 'Blackhole' has no attribute 'fileno'.\\
Using TortoiseHg Version 2.1.1 with Mercurial-1.9+10-e9264b45237d, Python 2.6.6, PyQt-4.8.3, Qt-4.7.1

Trying to serve a repository from one developers machine. We can use a web browser and connect to this machine and get the full web user interface. However, when trying to pull (or preview) incoming changes from this machine, it is dieing.\\
Any help is appreciated.\\
Thanks
fields.summary: Serve failing with 'Blackhole' object has no attribute 'fileno'

fields.description: Do you have any plans to extend your offering to include a Scrum interface?  I do not represent a scrum vendor.
fields.summary: Scrum

Hi, i am getting this error "ERROR - 2011-07-18 13:42:28 --> Severity: Warning  --> mysqli_num_rows() expects parameter 1 to be mysqli_result, boolean given D:\xampp174\htdocs\bb\system\database\drivers\mysqli\mysqli_result.php 37" when ever i INSERT something in database i am using mysqli driver for codeigniter

This is what written on line 37 of mysqli_result.php\\
function num_rows()\\
{\\
return @mysqli_num_rows($this->result_id);\\
}

although INSERT statement works perfectly but my log get this error and the result set is empty\\
$result = $this->db->query($sql, array($arrMemberInfo['first_name'],\\
$arrMemberInfo['last_name'],\\
$arrMemberInfo['email'],\\
$arrMemberInfo['passcode']));

here $result will be empty

fields.description:
Currently PNGs with alpha for project logos (the 35x35 icons) are handled as if they were overlaid over a black background (at least with several of my test icons).

It would be great if either the PNGs were handled as if they were on white background, or if their transparency were left untouched.
fields.summary: PNGs with alpha for project logos are handled as if the background is black

fields.description: hello world!
fields.summary: test issue

fields.description:
It is quite cool that you parse commit messages for paragraphs, but the {{{
}}} tags you insert make them look poor: there is a lot of extra space between the lines. I noticed this with https://bitbucket.org/aragost/hglock/changeset/019d137a6ece
fields.summary: Paragraphs and line-breaks in commit messages (BB-2079)

fields.description:
I'm using the Changeset REST API (http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BBDEV/Changesets). The pages are sorted descending but the results within a page are sorted ascending. So the first page of changesets are the most recent, but the first changset within the json result, isn't the most recent.  I would have expected the changesets within a page to be sorted descending as well.

Let me know if you need more info.
fields.summary: Change the order of Changesets via REST API to be newest to oldest (BB-2082)

fields.description:
I was closing off branches which I forgot to close with {{{$ hg commit --close-branch}}}, but then I forgot to pull in the latest changes from bitbucket, so I pull and update //after// closing the branches.

Everything updated fine on my machine, but when I pushed back to bitbucket, it seems the latest changset is wrong (even the ones tagged). Not sure if it's stupidity on my part or a bug (or both?). Sorry. I'll just create a new repo if it can't be helped, I still have a clean copy on another machine.

The repo's changeset timeline: https://bitbucket.org/john2x/sunrise/changesets

So, from that timeline, "tip" and "v1.1.0" should have the "update screenshot" commit, but neither have them when viewing the source.
fields.summary: My "tip" and tags points to wrong changesets?

fields.description:
Hi,

I'd like to see ace.ajax.org integrated into the source browser so all code editing and revisions can be managed by bitbucket and I don't have to keep synx my repos down to new machines :D

Thank you for a great service!
fields.summary: integrate ace.ajax.org editor (BB-2078)

I love your site!  However I think I found a bug.  I referenced a changeset id in a commit comment on a subsequent changeset and the link I got was this

Cheers and thanks!\\
Matt

(05:06:47 PM) cheryl: but the < button [actually black triangle] is there, and if i click that i get results

also, i hear the triangles are for paging...so why not put them with the results rather than the search?

line breaks are lost... :(

please improve ;)

Thanx Tobias
fields.summary: line-break-handling in bug-tracking is awsome bad (BB-2060)

fields.description:
Hi,

Some of us are using the issue tracker with a foreign language.

can you add in the textarea a new icon for writing direction? this way we will be able to write in right to left and not only left left to right direction.

Right to left direction is basically to support hebrew and arab languages.

Thanks
fields.summary: Issues text direction (BB-2053)

fields.description:
After reading http://audreyr.posterous.com/how-to-create-sphinx-docs-the-python-github-r I decided to see if it was as easy to set up ReadTheDocs integration here on BitBucket, but it turns out ReadTheDocs isn't one of the predefined services available on the admin page.

Details of the ReadTheDocs webhooks are here:\\
http://readthedocs.org/docs/read-the-docs/en/latest/webhooks.html

I _think_ you could use the POST hook to trigger the rebuild (I haven't tried it), but it would be a lot more obvious how to do it if there was an actual ReadTheDocs entry in the list.
fields.summary: ReadTheDocs commit hook as a service option (BB-2052)

fields.description:
As evidenced by the existence of the "enhancement" issue type, this tracker is also for BitBucket feature requests.

However, a user hitting up the support page could be forgiven for not realising that - all links to the tracker refer to it solely in its role as a bug reporting tool.
fields.summary: State on Support page that the tracker also covers feature requests

fields.description:
Hi! I just set up the HipChat service integration on a bunch of our repositories, and while it works great otherwise, the hostname on the links to specific changesets is wrong.

For example, I got a link like:

https://www.hipchat.com/mka/[the repository]/changeset/[the changeset]

in our chat room -- the host part should be bitbucket.org.
fields.summary: HipChat integration links are wrong

svn co https://bitbucket.org/avifatal/postp/\\

fields.summary: Cant fetch repository over svn (BB-2048)

fields.description:
If the title of a wiki page includes the word 'wiki' (e.g. 'Wiki testing'), the page is automatically renamed with a 'wiki|' prefix attached. This creates a problem in Windows as the pipe character is unsupported in file path.\\
Any pulls (or clones) of the repository result in an abort with error message: "abort: filename contains '|', which is reserved on Windows: 'wiki|Testing.wiki'".\\
Such repository is effectively rendered useless on a Windows system...:(
fields.summary: Word wiki in page's title creates | (pipe) character (BB-2047)

fields.description: if i send a message to myself, then go to my inbox and try to delete, it doesn't work.
fields.summary: deleting messages sent to yourself doesn't work

fields.description:
I just created a new private repository (https://bitbucket.org/jbreen/scrape-twitter) and was able to push to it from Eclipse A-OK.

But every push after my initial one displays as having come from an unmatched "jbreen" -- did I do something wrong? I authenticated as "jbreen" the same way each time.

Thanks,\\
Jeffrey

Thanks

fields.description:
It would be nice to be able to pick an .hgignore file from another repository in the same account to include in the root when I'm creating a new repository.

Thanks
fields.summary: ability to pick an .hgignore file from another repo when first creating new repository (BB-632)

fields.description:
Most Python packages are using reStructuredText to format e.g. their README files. According to the //Hitchhiker’s Guide to Packaging [1]//, README and other documentation files should have the *.txt extension.

It would be nice if Bitbucket would not only render *.rst files as rst, but also *.txt files. The Python Package Index does this already.

If an error occured while parsing *.txt files, you could simply fall back to plain text. I don’t think this should be a problem since *.rst files could also contain errors (so you should already handle them anyways).

If you are afraid that there will be a lot of errors for non-Python projects, you might activate this featere only for projects labeled as Python projects.

[1] http://guide.python-distribute.org/creation.html
fields.summary: Render reStructuredText in *.txt files. (BB-2043)

h2. Context of this bug:
We have a mercurial repository called 'DataControl'  with some other mercurial subrepos in it.

Now I have two heads in the repository 'DataControl', each representing different substates of the subrepos.

When I CLICK on the node of the non-marked head (because I want to merge the two heads) then the gui crashes with the error stack above.

I have forgotten the version where this is happening: Noticed in 2.0.3 - 2.0.5
fields.summary: crash of tortoise hg workbench when marking another head

fields.description:
Code blocks in the wiki have no padding under them. This means that anything that follows is not well separated and so -in the case of titles - can be difficult to pick out of the page.

In the screen shot we see an example of this as well that all other block level elements have a sensible amount of padding following them.
fields.summary: Too little padding under code blocks in the wiki
